reviews.review: 非常好

If you have a really weak computer and can't run modern shooters, then I suppose this game is fine - it's something, at least. But it very much shows its age in mechanics and gameplay. It's interesting to hop in and observe the antiquated relics of a bygone era, but shooters moved on and began becoming iteratively better over ten years ago.

Excelente juego. Muy entretenido.

Este é o tipo de jogo FPS que jamais vai morrer.

Ainda hoje é muito jogado, e proporciona uma boa diversão e desafio, com mapas muito bem desenhados e estilos de jogos diferente.

Diferente da grande maioria dos FPS, o jogador precisa ter pleno domínio do movimento da mira da arma, pois o jogo tenta ser fiel ao tiro em uma arma real. Cada time possui determinadas classes, e cada classe possui seu próprio equipamento. É um jogo puramente estratégico, onde não adianta tentar ser ninja e sair matando bala no peito e atirando desesperadamente. É preciso ser tático.

O seu rank não é baseado em kills e deaths, e sim na sua pontuação para alcançar o objetivo do jogo.

Super recomendado!
Cool!

Day of Defeat: Source is the new version of the game Day of Defeat, but now using the source engine (obviously). I really like how the guns play in the game, they are very balanced between the teams. The maps are also very well made and it really feels  like your in the midst of a Nazi/Yanks confrontation. 
     There are plenty of classes to choose from depending on your play style. Do you like rushing enemy positions gunning them down? Use the assault class. Do you like covering, supporting and precision shooting? Use the support class or the rifle class.
Additionally there's the machine gunner, sniper and rocketeer. All the classes also wield different guns and secondaries. 
     Smooth controls and they're easily changed for the player's preference. The graphics aren't that good, but they'll do and it isn't something you'll notice during gameplay. 
     Using tactics, different firing techniques and grenades are necessary to win matches.

I recommend this game to hardcore FPS players who likes a WW2 challenge.

Por mucho tiempo que pase sigo jugando y me lo sigo pasando igual de bien como el primer día y continuará siendo así, no requiere de mucha potencia del ordenador y a cambio da horas y horas de diversión. Recomendado 100%.

I am a long time fanboy of Day of Defeat and played it from it's early inception as a mod of Half-Life.... spent countless hours with friends playing LAN games.... this game along with Counter-Strike and BF1942 played a huge role in inspiring me and some close friends to start The Matrix Gaming Centre in 2002, which is a lan gaming centre featuring over 100 gaming systems.... but enough about that.... 

Pros
*Easy to learn controls and within 5-10 minutes a n00bie can be well on their way to experiencing the joy of lan gaming
*Overall great balance
*Smooth and realistic game-play
*There is no better feeling than "Shovelling a friend or three" 

Cons
*Only 6 official maps, although there are plenty of community maps but it can be a bit of a pain to filter through them to find the good ones
*Dwindling online player base
 
Overall, DOD: Source is a classic fantastic WWII fps and scores 9/10

Today (as is 21.06.2014) the game was on Steam Summer Sale so i decided to buy it and compare the game with Wolfenstein: Enemy Territory.

Pros: 
- graphics, congrats Valve this is done right, i personally like it
- no more pros 

Cons:
- few populated servers and if you are new to this type of game you will find it hard to grasp
- campers every where on the few populated servers, making the learning experience harder and not worth the time to do it
- recoil on weapons is soooooooooooooooooooooooo high, the weapons on  Wolfenstein: Enemy Territory seem to have more balance at this point

If you find the time and adjust yourself to the recoil from the weapons maybe, just maybe, you will find some fun times. Playing Day of Defeat: Source is worse if you compare it to CS:GO or CS:S, since its better to aim lower than the center of the screen to hit a player...

This is not worth the time or the money even if its on Steam Summer Sale now.

Day of Defeat se baseia no trabalho em equipe e na coordenação organizada entre ações de tomada e defesa de territórios. O jogo é baseado em rounds entre duas equipes, para vencer, uma delas precisa capturar e manter sob seu poder todas as "Flags".
Para quem gosta de jogos de temática de segunda guerra conseguirá uma exelente jogatina.

The classic. It may not be as fancy as all the newer games regarding slightly more modern warfare, but there will always be something special about fighting the germans in WW II. The game itself is one of the earliest class based FPS models, which requires a large amount of team work in orde rto succeed. The community and servers that are still active have a large number of regulars, meaning you're likely to see the same people over and over again.

Day of Defeat: Source is a fairly good game with multi-multiplayer servers, it is a cheap game to buy, and there's almost no lag. The downsides to it though, is that you can't aim with half of the guns, some guns are to weak, and it depends on what team you're on for good guns. So, altogether, I would rate this game, sadly, 6.5/10. I wish I could give it more for what it seems like, but it's not the best game in the world.

Jeu sans intérêt à part peut être pour ceux qui aiment s'ennerver ou casser des souris par cartons entiers.
Les graphismes sont corrects sans plus, mais là ou le jeu pêche c'est dans la gestion des dégâts ; les  mitraillettes sont inutilisables du fait d'un recul complètement fantaisiste, le fusil par contre vous tue en un seul coup, même touché à l'orteil! Inutile donc de viser c'est du pif! J'ai vu des joueurs se prendre des impacts en pleine poitrine et continuer à strafer, sauter et killer dans tous les sens! On croirait Unreal tournament. Des tirs tendus de grenades à bout portant qui ne blesse même pas...des bugs, des cheaters en pagaille... et des grenades, des grenades, des grenades qui tombent de partout. A ce niveau là vaut mieux jouer à la bataille navale c'est mieux.  Ou est le réalisme ? Assurément pas dans DoD:S 
Valve à réussi le tour de force de transformer un bon mod, je parle du premier dod qui malgré ses imperfections était au moins jouable lui, en une sorte de counter strike like nauséabond fait pour la masse. Les timmy pourront se réjouir, ce jeu est fait pour eux, les plus anciens comme moi resteront sans doute sur l'ancienne version.

Day of Defeat: Source is in my honest opinion the best Source Engine 2 Valve Game remake. It combined great hit detection with brilliant map design. It's WWII aesthetic helps boost it, but the game doesn't forget where it came from. By sticking to its roots in the original DoD, it remains an entertaining game while also providing us with a nostalgic feeling. As a piece of art, DoD puts out all of the stops in its design. The weapons look pristine but follow Valve's usual FPS rules, allowing for great gameplay akin to the Counter Strike series.
Its a good price and a good game.

This is simply amazing game. There are generally community based maps, but thats not entirly a bad thing. Because of this more maps will come out more frequently. I found many maps to be historically acurate. A great ecample would be Omah, based on Omaha Beach Invasion of 1944; WWII. The guns are also somewhat acurate. This game is great, besides the fact how communication is not **always** an option depending on your team. It's definatly worth $10
